Algren's turn is no different than the others. He is decl unceremoniously onto the pile of corpses. Back in the. hotel room.: Algren sits, staring into the middle distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan, good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Colonel Bagley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down. This is Mr. Omura, from Japan, and his two associates who, so far as I can tell, don't have names...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OMURA 40, is a handsome and intelligent man. He watches A as Algren pours a glass or whiskey from a decanter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're looking to hire real American soldiers to create the first Japanese Imperial Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Algren looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Japan's got it in mind to become a civilized country and they're willing to spend what it takes to hire white experts to do the job right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Algren takes a slow lip of whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Gant has already agreed to serve. You would be m y second-in-command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With approval from Washington, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both governments prefer to consider our mission unofficial. We'd be there as non-combatants

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: only, advisors to the Japanese officers. Help them with training, ordinance and the like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ought to think about it., Captain. Unless you intend to take up a career in the theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an agreement with the Winchester Corporation -- I'm sure these people have some concept of what an agreement is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omura suddenly speaks. His English is flawless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are paid seven dollars for each performance. You do, on average, fourteen performances a year. We will pay you 400 dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the hereditary Emperor, His Highness the Enlightened Meiji, to lead the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these warlords just ... gave up hundreds of years of power?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Economic incentives were offered. Most provincial leaders saw the financial benefits of modernization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about those that didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To deal with those who have resisted, the Emperor has decided to create an Army with allegiance only to him... We considered hiring advisors from Germany, but your Ambassador reminded us of your experience in suppressing rebellious elements in your Civil War.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This evocation of the Civil War is not lost on Algren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are we supposed to be fighting against?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Mori Katsumoto. He is samurai.

dialogues.text: Samurai?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word you might use it "warrior". But that does not quite capture it ... Katsumoto once served the Emperor but he is now a traitor who leads a band of traitors. He must be punished.

dialogues.text: Algren looks pointedly at Bagley.

dialogues.text: You told them about our experiences together on Sutter's Hill, did you, Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know I was your commanding officer. Yes.

dialogues.text: Get him in front of the troops, you'll see. Top of his class at West Point. Brilliant tactician. Even wrote a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you rather I hadn't recommended you for the medal. Nathan? Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both know why you helped me, Colonel. Don't expect me to go all weepy with gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect you to do your job. Save the self-pity for your own time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
